item.title: Israel-Gaza: Four-year-old girl among released hostages
item.description: Avigail Idan, who turned four while she was held hostage by Hamas, was among nine children released.

item.title: Terry Venables: Former England manager dies aged 80 after a long illness
item.description: Terry Venables, who led England to the semi-finals of Euro 96, dies at the age of 80 after a long illness.

item.title: Booker Prize 2023: Ireland's Paul Lynch wins with Prophet Song
item.description: The dystopian novel depicting an Ireland slipping into totalitarianism bags the prestigious award.

item.title: Jade Goody: Son Bobby Brazier dedicates Strictly Come Dancing routine to mum
item.description: The EastEnders star says his mother's death from cervical cancer in 2009 "changed my life completely".

item.title: Slick videos or more 'authentic' content? The Israel-Gaza battles raging on TikTok and X
item.description: Pro-Palestinian TikTok posts gain traction with Gen Z, while slicker Israeli content is popular on X.

item.title: Leasehold reforms: Michael Gove confident bill will pass by next election
item.description: The bill would make it easier and cheaper for homeowners to extend their lease or buy their freehold.

item.title: Sunak welcomes foreign firms' £29.5bn 'vote of confidence'
item.description: The prime minister says foreign investors' plans to invest £29.5bn is a "huge vote of confidence".

item.title: Vermont: Three Palestinian students shot near US campus
item.description: Police in Vermont are still searching for the lone gunman who opened fire in Burlington.

item.title: Metro Bank shareholders to vote on rescue deal
item.description: A deal to raise extra funds was struck last month after speculation about Metro's financial position.

item.title: Tobacco firm calls for tougher rules on vapes
item.description: BAT wants sellers to be licensed, and sweet flavours banned

item.title: Conservative MP Lee Anderson claims he was 'guaranteed' job to defect
item.description: Senior Conservative sources say he told them he had been approached by Reform UK.

item.title: Climate protest: More than 100 arrested at world's largest coal port
item.description: Protesters say the 30-hour blockade stopped over half a million tonnes of coal from leaving Australia.

item.title: The Papers: 'Farewell El Tel' and Sunak-Braverman 'migrant deal'
item.description: Tributes to ex-England boss Terry Venables feature in Monday's newspapers after he died over the weekend.

item.title: Terry Venables tributes by Gary Lineker, Gareth Southgate, Ange Postecoglou, Gary Neville
item.description: Terry Venables was "the best English coach we've had", says Gary Lineker as he leads tributes to the former England boss.

item.title: Kenya abortion: Women go to backstreet clinics amid legal ambiguity
item.description: An estimated seven Kenyan women die a day after unsafe abortions even though they are legal in some cases.

item.title: The job sharing apps that feel like online dating
item.description: New website platforms are working like matchmakers to connect potential job sharers.

item.title: Olivia Dean: BBC Introducing's Artist of the Year finds her voice
item.description: BBC Introducing's Artist of the Year talks about finding her voice and protecting her sound.

item.title: The Laird of Tomintoul: £5m police fraudster who lorded over village
item.description: 'Lord Williams' was jailed in 1995 for fraud, but locals say his spending left a positive legacy.

item.title: Elgin Marbles in UK 'like cutting Mona Lisa in half'
item.description: The Greek prime minister calls for the reunification of the artefacts, also known as the Parthenon Sculptures.

item.title: Raye to Louis Theroux: 'Abuse of power can be crippling'
The last of their kind: The unique life of Pakistan's Wakhi shepherdesses
item.description: The Wakhi shepherdesses share life in Pakistan's mountains and how they have changed things for a new generation.

item.title: Interest rates: Why there is more pain still to come
item.description: Inflation may be easing but the impact of high interest rates is still to kick in for many people.

item.title: Booker Prize 2023 shortlist: Who are the six authors hoping to win tonight?
item.description: Three men called Paul are on the shortlist of six. Will one of them take the prize in tonight's ceremony?

item.title: Essex pylon corridor compensation plan 'insulting'
item.description: People living near a planned pylon corridor describe a government compensation offer as a "con".

item.title: Will there be frost and snow this weekend?
item.description: Colder conditions are on the way for the UK, but just how cold will it get?

item.title: Busking on the London Underground for 20 years
item.description: Musician Fabio Tedde has been busking on the Tube for 20 years - and has no plans to stop.

item.title: 'Halo' spotted around the Moon across England
item.description: The phenomenon is caused by the refraction of moonlight from ice crystals.

item.title: CM Punk: WWE star makes shock return at Survivor Series
item.description: After an acrimonious split with the company in 2014, the 45-year-old returns at an event in Chicago.

item.title: Thousands march against antisemitism in London
item.description: Organisers say the event is the first of its kind since the Israel-Gaza war broke out.

item.title: Manchester police probe Hamilton theatregoers' fight
item.description: Two people are said to be involved in a fight at the Palace Theatre in Manchester on Friday night.

item.title: Riot police attacked by 'hostile' crowd in Scottish village
item.description: An officer was treated in hospital after being hit by a firework as trouble flared in Auchinleck, East Ayrshire.

item.title: Catherine Tate: Doctor Who was the best job ever
item.description: The comedian and actor confesses she was not a Dr Who fan before becoming the Doctor's companion.

item.title: Only shop on Lismore saved after community buyout
item.description: Over 200 people backed the campaign to secure Lismore's closure-threatened store for the future.

item.title: Ukraine war: Fierce row erupts over 2024 election
item.description: Some right-wing US politicians want Ukraine to vote as scheduled next year. Ukrainians don't.

item.title: Fear of spike in dumped bully XL dogs under new ban
item.description: Owners may have "nowhere else to turn" if vets cannot cope with demand, rescue homes warn.

item.title: Indo-Chinese cuisine makes a splash in US dining
item.description: The cuisine, wildly popular in Indian streets and restaurants, is now finding a place on food menus in the US.

item.title: Sierra Leone under curfew after breakout from Freetown's Pademba Road Prison
item.description: President Julius Maada Bio said most of the leaders behind the attack had been arrested and calm restored.

item.title: Argentina election: Javier Milei's radical proposals face test of reality
item.description: A closer look at what Argentina's president-elect has said he will do once he is in office.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'tiny creatures'
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

item.title: 'Joyful' art helps shine new light on colonial history
item.description: Artists aim to alter how we view the colonialist past through the lens of a library's collection.

item.title: Bowie's handwritten lyrics could sell at auction for £100,000
item.description: The auction will also include backstage photographs, lyric notes from Jim Morrison and guitars.

item.title: Mum pulls horse statue 160 miles after girl's suicide
item.description: Emma is taking on the challenge after her 16-year-old daughter unexpectedly took her own life.

item.title: 'We found love in our Doctor Who Shop'
item.description: Meet the woman who met her future husband through their shared love of Doctor Who.

item.title: Pakefield caravans evacuated as cliff fall reveals bomb
item.description: The unexploded device is discovered after spring tides cause cliffs and part of a road to collapse.

item.title: Alejandro Garnacho: Has Man Utd winger already won goal of the season?
item.description: Has Alejandro Garnacho already wrapped up goal of the season - and how does his effort compare to some classic overhead kicks?

item.title: Tottenham 1-2 Aston Villa: Jermaine Jenas analysis of Ange Postecoglou's side
item.description: MOTD2 pundit Jermaine Jenas says the trip to Manchester City next weekend might be the time for Tottenham manager Ange Postecoglou to adapt his playing style.

item.title: Garth Crooks' Team of the Week: Garnacho, Rice, Ederson, Ake, Gordon
item.description: Which players impressed our football pundit Garth Crooks enough to make his latest Team of the Week?

item.title: Match of the Day 2 analysis: Alejandro Garnacho's bicycle kick was 'one in a million'
item.description: Match of the Day 2's Mark Chapman, Danny Murphy, Theo Walcott and Jermaine Jenas discuss Alejandro Garnacho's sensational goal of the season contender in Manchester United's win at Everton.

item.title: Davis Cup final 2023: Italy beat Australia to win first title for 47 years
item.description: Jannik Sinner beats Alex de Minaur in straight sets to secure Italy's first Davis Cup title for 47 years.

item.title: WSL: Heavy defeats expose brutal gap between top four and rest
item.description: Heading into the final international break of 2023, the Women's Super League table has a very familiar look - and the results this weekend indicate it will stay that way.

item.title: For some Israeli hostage families, the painful wait goes on
item.description: There was a mix of hope and fear this weekend for the families of hostages expected to remain in Gaza.

item.title: West Bank: Eight Palestinians killed during Israeli raid
item.description: The Israeli army says it was mounting a raid in the city of Jenin to capture a Palestinian suspect.

item.title: Emily Hand among the 13 Israeli hostages released by Hamas
item.description: Irish-Israeli Emily Hand, who was kidnapped on 7 October, was freed as part of a truce deal with Hamas.

item.title: West Bank crowds celebrate as bus carries freed Palestinian prisoners
item.description: Thirty-nine Palestinian prisoners were freed by Israel in exchange for hostages held in Gaza.

item.title: When this truce ends, the decisive next phase of war begins
item.description: If Israel decides to go south, a larger humanitarian disaster could be looming, writes Paul Adams.

item.title: Gazans take stock of their damaged neighbourhoods during temporary truce
item.description: Some residents have returned to northern Gaza during a four-day pause in fighting between Israel and Hamas.

item.title: Israel's Palestinian prisoner release a 'window of hope' in West Bank
item.description: The return of 39 women and teenagers is being seen by some as a symbolic victory over Israel.

item.title: More hostages released by Hamas despite agonising delay
item.description: Urgent diplomacy enables the release of 13 more Israelis and 39 Palestinian prisoners under the fragile Gaza truce deal.

item.title: Gazans use truce to search for loved ones and check damaged homes
item.description: The pause in fighting allows Gazans to gather supplies and assess the widespread damage.

item.title: Who are the released hostages?
item.description: Forty-one people captured during the 7 October attacks have been released by Hamas.

item.title: Gaza hostages: 'My father wasn’t released, but I’m happy for those families'
item.description: Relatives of those held hostage by Hamas hope Friday's deal paves the way for more to be released.

item.title: Thai hostages: Relief for woman who feared boyfriend died in Hamas attack
item.description: Kittiya Thuengsaeng feared her boyfriend was killed on 7 October - but now says he's been freed from Gaza.

item.title: Israel hostages: Freed women and child helped out of ambulance
item.description: They are some of the reported 24 hostages released by Hamas in Gaza and transferred into Egypt.

item.title: Israel-Gaza: Families' relief as hostages released
item.description: Hostages including young children and elderly women are freed from Gaza during a temporary ceasefire.

item.title: How the Israel-Hamas hostage deal came together
item.description: The "excruciating process" involved four countries, spy masters and presidential calls, a US official says.

item.title: Watch: The moment fighting officially paused as part of Israel-Gaza deal
item.description: A long-anticipated four-day pause in hostilities has come into effect, with both sides saying the pause is temporary.

item.title: Gaza Strip in maps: Life in Gaza under siege
item.description: Find out more about what it is like to live in the Gaza Strip, from the economy to education, health and water.

item.title: David Cameron warns Israel over Gaza civilian casualties
item.description: The foreign secretary tells Israel it will never be secure unless there is "security and stability" for the Palestinian people.

item.title: Yahya Sinwar: Who is the Hamas leader in Gaza?
item.description: Thousands of Israeli troops are trying to find the man who heads the organisation's political wing.
